title: How to Make a Homestyle Tomato Soup

steps.headline: Chop the vegetables, namely:
steps.description: Onion (1) Tomatoes (4-5) Garlic (4-5) Carrots (3-4 medium sized ones)

steps.headline: Boil 400 milliliters of water and add all the chopped vegetables except the tomatoes.
Add spices:
steps.description: Pepper (1 teaspoon) 2 cloves 1 teaspoon of salt into the boiling mixture. Add spices that you would use to add a spicy touch to your regular dishes.

steps.headline: Grind the chopped tomatoes to a thick paste consistency.
steps.description: Dilute it by adding some water.

steps.headline: Add this paste into the boiling mixture and allow it to boil until the raw smell of the vegetables vanishes.
Make cream for the soup by adding:
steps.description: 2 teaspoon Maida 1 teaspoon butter or ghee 40-50 ml milk

steps.headline: Mix all of these ingredients together in a bowl.
Add the cream to the soup by constantly stirring it (if you don't stir, it will create lumps in your soup).
steps.description: This cream will make your soup a bit thick.

steps.headline: Add chopped coriander and serve it hot with a splash of pepper powder.

text: Chop the vegetables, namely: Onion (1) Tomatoes (4-5) Garlic (4-5) Carrots (3-4 medium sized ones) Boil 400 milliliters of water and add all the chopped vegetables except the tomatoes.  Add spices: Pepper (1 teaspoon) 2 cloves 1 teaspoon of salt into the boiling mixture. Add spices that you would use to add a spicy touch to your regular dishes. Grind the chopped tomatoes to a thick paste consistency. Dilute it by adding some water. Add this paste into the boiling mixture and allow it to boil until the raw smell of the vegetables vanishes.  Make cream for the soup by adding: 2 teaspoon Maida 1 teaspoon butter or ghee 40-50 ml milk Mix all of these ingredients together in a bowl.  Add the cream to the soup by constantly stirring it (if you don't stir, it will create lumps in your soup). This cream will make your soup a bit thick. Allow it to cook.  Add chopped coriander and serve it hot with a splash of pepper powder.
